courses.name: Introduction to Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Nature of communication and its development; types of speech, language and hearing disorders; professional preparation, settings, and work of speech-language pathologists and audiologists. Course graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: Signed English
courses.description: Introduction to the English-based sign system, Signed English, a system that has been developed to bridge the gap between English and American Sign Language.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Communication, Science and Disorder majors only during Early Registration

courses.name: Human Language
courses.description: (same as ANTHRO 1060, LINGST 1060 and ENGLSH 1060). General introduction to various aspects of linguistic study. Elementary analysis of language data with some attention to application of linguistic study to other disciplines.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: American Sign Language I
courses.description: Introduction to American Sign Language (ASL). Development of basic expressive and receptive skills in ASL, the manual alphabet, numbers, and signed vocabulary. Includes an overview of ASL syntax and grammar. Course graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: American Sign Language II
courses.description: This course is designed to increase students' understanding of American Sign Language. Students will increase their sign vocabulary, expressive and receptive skills, an understanding of ASL syntax and grammar.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: C_S_D 1100 or equivalent

courses.name: Survey of Communication Disorders
courses.description: Systematic survey of the disorders of speech, language and hearing.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: American Sign Language III
courses.description: This course expands on vocabulary and signing skills developed in ASL II. Includes review of ASL grammar and extensive discussions of ASL linguistic structure and Deaf culture. Class is conducted entirely in ASL. Course graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: C_S_D 1200 with minimum grade of C or instructor's consent

courses.name: American Phonetics
courses.description: (same as LINGST 3010). Analysis of production and acoustics of the sounds of speech with an emphasis on American English; practice in broad and narrow transcription using the International Phonetic Alphabet.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Normal Language Development
courses.description: Language development in children and changes in language processing during normal aging. Cognition and language; language learning processes; language sample analysis; relationship between spoken and written language.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Normal Language Development - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Language development in children and changes in language processing during normal aging. Cognition and language; language learning processes; language sample analysis; relationship between spoken and written language.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Anatomy and Physiology of the Speech Mechanism
courses.description: (same as LINGST 3210). Introduction to anatomical and functional aspects of the speech mechanism.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Speech Acoustics
courses.description: (same as LINGST 3220).  An introduction to the acoustic aspects of speech as they relate to the respiratory, phonatory, resonatory, and articulatory systems.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only or instructor's consent

courses.name: Hearing Science
courses.description: Introduction to the nature of sound and its measurement; anatomy and physiology of the auditory and vestibular systems; psychoacoustic methods and phenomena.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: Topics in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester. May be repeated with program consent.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing and instructor's consent

courses.name: Language Disorders in Children
courses.description: Overview of language disorders from early childhood through adolescence. Includes language disorders as primary disability and as secondary to other disabilities. Introduction to assessment and intervention.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Language Disorders in Children - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Overview of language disorders from early childhood through adolescence. Includes language disorders as primary disability and as secondary to other disabilities. Introduction to assessment and intervention.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorder majors only

courses.name: Language Disorders of Adults
courses.description: Introduction to acquired adult language disorders.  Review of neuroanatomy/physiology, etiology and symptomatology, with introduction to assessment and treatment procedures.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Clinical Applications of Sign Language
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 7050). This course covers research, theory, and methods of using sign language to assist the communication of the Deaf, individuals with disabilities, and hearing learners. Use of sign language to improve literacy and classroom management will also be targeted. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Instructor's consent required

courses.name: Fluency Disorders
courses.description: Introduction to the nature, assessment, and treatment of fluency disorders.  Emphasis on developmental stuttering.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Voice Disorders
courses.description: Introduction to voice disorders in children and adults. Includes overview of perceptual and instrumental assessment procedures and selected treatment approaches.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Disorders of Phonology and Articulation
courses.description: Overview of disorders of use and production of speech sounds with an emphasis on developmental disorders. Introduction to assessment and treatment.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Introduction to Audiology
courses.description: Principles and techniques of audiological testing; etiologies of hearing impairment; current technologies in rehabilitation.
courses.prerequisites: C_S_D 3230; Communication Science and Disorders majors only or instructor's consent

courses.name: Aural Rehabilitation
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 7340). Identification, evaluation, and management of problems associated with hearing impairment in both children and adults. Includes issues related to speech/language development, communication, education, and social factors.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Neurophysiology for Speech, Language, and Hearing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 7430). Principles of basic neurophysiology, emphasizing correlation of structure and function of the nervous system.
courses.prerequisites: Communications Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Psycholinguistics
courses.description: (same as LINGST 4810; cross-leveled with C_S_D 7810, LINGST 7810). Examination of the knowledge and processes that underlie the human ability to produce and understand language.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Speech Perception
courses.description: (same as LINGST 4820; cross-leveled with C_S_D 7820, LINGST 7820). Selected topics in the perceptual processing of speech sounds and spoken language.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Individual Differences in Language Processing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D  7830). Examination of the normal variations exhibited across individuals in the acquisition, use, and representation of language.  Also considered are individual differences seen in second language learning, the aging process, and language disorders.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Language and Development in Infancy
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 7840). Overview of theory and research on the foundations and development of language in infancy (0 to 2 years), with an emphasis on relevant, interrelated areas of development, individual differences, early recognition of delay, and assessment.
courses.prerequisites: senior standing required. Instructor's consent required

courses.name: Clinical Observation in Communication Disorders
courses.description: Directed clinical observations designed to prepare the student for clinical practicum. Required for professional certification. Graded on a S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders  majors only

courses.name: Clinical Apprenticeship in Communication Disorders
courses.description: Supervised observation and clinical experience in speech-language pathology for undergraduates.
courses.prerequisites: senior standing and departmental consent. Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Research Apprenticeship
courses.description: Research apprenticeship with a faculty member, assisting in the development and execution of research in communication processes and disorders. May be repeated to 6 hrs. maximum.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Directed Reading in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Independent reading; reports.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Honors Thesis
courses.description: Individual honors thesis on a topic selected with a faculty advisor. Requires planning, conducting, and writing up a research project under the guidance of a faculty member. Successful completion of thesis and maintenance of 3.3 GPA, leads to degree with departmental honors. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Senior standing; 3.3 GPA; 3.5 GPA in Communication Science and Disorders courses; instructor's consent. Restricted to Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Topics in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Study of selected topics in speech pathology/audiology. Topic and credit may vary from semester to semester. May be repeated for credit with instructor and departmental consent.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Clinical Applications of Sign Language
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 4050). This course covers research, theory, and methods of using sign language to assist the communication of the Deaf, individuals with disabilities, and hearing learners. Use of sign language to improve literacy and classroom management will also be targeted.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Instructor's consent required

courses.name: Problems in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Individual study not leading to thesis or dissertation.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Aural Rehabilitation
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 4340). Identification, evaluation, and management of problems associated with hearing impairment in both children and adults. Includes issues related to speech/language development, communication, education, and social factors.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only

courses.name: Neurophysiology for Speech, Language, and Hearing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D) 4430). Principles of basic neurophysiology, emphasizing correlation of structure and function of the nervous system.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors or instructor's consent

courses.name: Psycholinguistics
courses.description: (same as LINGST 7810: cross-leveled with C_S_D 4810, LINGST 4810). Examination of the knowledge and processes that underlie the human ability to produce and understand language.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Speech Perception
courses.description: (same as LINGST 7820; cross-leveled with C_S_D 4820, LINGST 4820). Selected topics in the perceptual processing of speech sounds and spoken language.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Individual Differences in Language Processing
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 7830). Examination of the normal variations exhibited across individuals in the acquisition, use, and representation of language.  Also considered are individual differences seen in second language learning, the aging process, and language disorders.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Language and Development in Infancy
courses.description: (cross-leveled with C_S_D 4840). Overview of theory and research on the foundations and development of language in infancy (0 to 2 years), with an emphasis on relevant, interrelated areas of development, individual differences, early recognition of delay, and assessment.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: Topics in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Study of selected topics in speech pathology/audiology. Topic and credit may vary from semester to semester. May be repeated for credit with instructor and departmental consent.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent, instructor's

courses.name: Developmental Language Disorders
courses.description: Nature, etiology, assessment and management of childhood language disorders.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Acquired Language Disorders
courses.description: Etiology, symptomatology, assessment and rehabilitation of acquired neurogenic communication disorders in aphasia, traumatic brain injury, and dementia.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Research in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Independent research leading to a report but not to a thesis or dissertation.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Problems in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Individual study not leading to thesis or dissertation.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Seminar: Contemporary Topics in Speech-Language Pathology
courses.description: Advanced study involving critical literature review and research on selected topics in speech and language. May be repeated for up to 6 credits.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Research in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Research leading to thesis or dissertation.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent. Graded on a S/U basis only

courses.name: Motor Speech Disorders
courses.description: Etiology, symptomatology, epidemiology, and prognosis of motor speech disorders resulting from acquired neurological damage.  Emphasis on clinical assessment and rehabilitation procedures. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Disorders of Fluency
courses.description: Identification and remediation of fluency disorders in children and adults.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Voice Science and Voice Disorders
courses.description: Diagnosis and management of communicative disorders resulting from pathologies or misuse of the phonatory system. Includes experience with pertinent laboratory instrumentation. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: restricted to MHS CSD students; or with instructor's consent

courses.name: Dysphagia
courses.description: Etiology, symptomatology, and epidemiology of acquired and developmental swallowing disorders (dysphagia).  Emphasis on instrumental and non-instrumental methods for assessing and treating dysphagia.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Orofacial Anomalies
courses.description: Nature, causes, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of communication associated with congenital orofacial anomalies. Emphasis on cleft palate.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Clinical Methods in Speech-Language Pathology
courses.description: An introduction to clinical procedures and evidence-based intervention methods relating to speech and language disorders.  Topics include session design, data collection, measurement of progress, reporting of clinical results, and various treatment options.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Diagnosis in Speech-Language Pathology
courses.description: General principles of diagnosis; specific diagnostic tools and procedures for various speech and language disorders.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Neurological Bases of Speech and Language
courses.description: Structure and function of the human brain and nervous system including general organization, cranial nerves, basal ganglia, cerebellum, and descending motor pathways as related to the field of speech language pathology.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Speech Sound Disorders
courses.description: Principles of clinical assessment and treatment for speech sound disorders in children.  Includes foundations in research on early speech sound acquisition, organic and developmental disorders, and treatment efficacy.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Reading and Language Disabilities in School-Age Children
courses.description: Theories, research, and practice in reading development and disorders. Assessment and remediation of reading disabilities related to language disorders of various etiologies including developmental language disorders and head injury.
courses.prerequisites: C_S_D 4020 or C_S_D 8020

courses.name: Augmentative and Alternative Communication
courses.description: Students will learn the principles of AAC assessment, methods of intervention, and types of technology available for individuals unable to communicate fully through speech. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Issues in Professional Practice
courses.description: Organizational, inter-professional, economic, legal, and ethical aspects of delivering speech, language, and hearing services. Graded on A/F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Clinical Language Analysis
courses.description: This course provides a theoretical framework for understanding the morphology, semantics, syntax, and pragmatics of English as well as practice in the analysis of typical and atypical language samples.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Clinical Practice in Audiology
courses.description: Supervised practice in hearing screening, hearing conservation, and aural re/habilitation.  May be repeated for credit.  Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: Clinical Practice in Speech-Language Pathology
courses.description: Supervised clinical practice in speech pathology for graduate students. May be repeated for credit.
courses.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only

courses.name: Directed Reading in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Independent reading; reports.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Research in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Independent research leading to a report but not to a thesis or dissertation.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Seminar: Contemporary Topics in Speech-Language Pathology
courses.description: Advanced study involving critical literature review and research on selected topics in speech and language. May be repeated for up to 6 credits.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Research in Communication Science and Disorders
courses.description: Research leading to thesis or dissertation. Graded on a S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent
